answers.answer: The CA-125 is generally not reliable in pre-menopausal women.  Yes, it can be raised for endometriosis, cysts, and infections.  It is only used as a guide, not a rule, for instances where suspicious cysts occur and a raised CA-125.  Many women hear had raised CA-125's and benign cysts.  Please let us know how the ultrasound goes and what the treatment plan will be.  Good luck.

What Trudie said is completely true.  It is not considered reliable in pre-menopausal women and can be raised for many reasons.  Having the ultrasound done is a good idea and let us know how the results are. Am hoping to hear good news!

question: Hi,I am new to this since I desperately need some advice.  Last SeptemberI had my annual gyn exam. A new doctor since my original one left the group. (I loved her.)  This new doctor told me that she felt a fibroid and possibly a cyst on an ovary.  I had to have a trans-vaginal ultrasound which I scheduled right away.  It showed two small cysts on my left ovary. She also suggested I get a Ca-125 done and it was normal.  She suggested I have surgery but I went and got a second opinion (found where my original doctor whom I loved went) and she said, no surgery... let's wait two months and have another ultrasound.  I waited, had the second one in November and the cyst shrunk down considerably. I was sooooooooooooo relieved. I just went to my regular doctor for my annual bloodwork and asked that she do a Ca-125 just for the heck of it.  She agreed and I got a phone call two days ago saying that my Ca-125 went to 50.  I totally freaked out... crying and crying.   I couldn't control myself.  I cancelled all my plans for that night since I couldn't think straight.  I called my gyn whom I love and she is away at a medical conference until Sept. 2nd.  I was desperate so I called the other gyn and she got me in for another ultrasound on Friday.  It is Sunday and I haven 't heard anything... I am so nervous.  How accurate is this Ca-125 test????  I've read that fibroids can cause this as well as endrometrisis (sp?).  I was told previously that I have both conditions.  No symptoms at all... I am 46 with no family history of anything but diabetes which I don't have, and I have totally regular periods.Any help would be sooooo very much appreciated.Ann
title: How accurate is a CA-125?
